business.headline: Trump allies plan to privatise Fannie and Freddie, says reportThe discussions involve prominent figures close to Trump, including Larry Kudlow, the former director of the National Economic Council, and John McEntee, who previously worked in the White House.

Sebi chief addresses conflict of interest allegations with 3 big clarificationsThe Buchs firmly denied any wrongdoing, offering detailed explanations to counter allegations tied to consulting roles, rental income, and Madhabi Puri Buch's ICICI Bank stock options.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as markets take breather after strong rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 135.83 points to 82,926.88, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 43 points lower at 25,345.90.

Sebi chief, husband reject conflict of interest charges, call it false, motivatedIn a joint statement, Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and husband Dhaval Buch rejected recent allegations of conflict of interest as "false, malicious, and defamatory."

Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv shares gain amid housing unit IPO buzzThe buzz around the Bajaj Housing Finance IPO, which is set to make its stock market debut on September 16, has led traders on Dalal Street to snap up shares of other publicly traded Bajaj companies, hoping to capitalise on the momentum.

Western Carriers IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe or skip? Western Carriers (India) Limited has allocated 85,96,743 equity shares to 15 anchor investors, raising Rs 148 crore before its proposed IPO.
SpiceJet shares surge 9%: What's fuelling the rally and will it continue?SpiceJet share price: Despite regulatory challenges, the airline's shares have surged recently. Will the rally hold?

Adani Group rejects Hindenburg claim of Swiss banks' $310 million funds freezeHindenburg cited a Swiss media outlet, Gotham City, which alleged that more than $310 million belonging to an alleged frontman for billionaire Gautam Adani is sequestered in six Swiss banks. The Adani Group "unequivocally" rejected the claim.

Amazon, Flipkart found violating Indian competition laws: ReportA probe by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) found that e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart engaged in anti-competitive practices by favouring select sellers on their platforms.

Understanding circle rates: A simple guide for homebuyers and sellersUnderstanding the concept of circle rates, and how they influence property valuations, has become critical for anyone navigating the real estate market.
Retail inflation rises to 3.65% in August, second lowest in last five yearsRetail inflation rises to 3.65 per cent in August compared to 3.6 per cent in July, as per government data.

India's semiconductor boom: These stocks could be your best pickThe development of the semiconductor value chain—ranging from chip design to manufacturing and assembly, is expected to benefit various companies in the sector.

Sensex gains 1,500 points on US rate cut optimism; Granules India tanks 17%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1,439.55 points to 82,962.71 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained nearly 470.45 points to settle at 25,388.90.

Explained: Why Granules India shares crashed nearly 17% todayGranules India stock price: With this drop, the stock now trades roughly 22% below its all-time high of Rs 724.55, reached earlier in the month

PwC to cut 1,800 jobs in US; First major layoff since 2009The layoff affects approximately 2.5% of the company's US workforce and impacts a range of positions, including associates, managing directors, and employees in business services, audit, and tax departments.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 2 Army personnel killed in gunfight with terrorists in J&K's KishtwarThe security forces have cordoned off the area and operations are on in the area, the Indian Army said in a statement.

Sam Pitroda says not aware of assault on India Today reporter by Congress team in DallasIndian Overseas Congress chief Sam Pitroda said he was not aware of India Today reporter being manhandled allegedly by Congress workers and said he would follow up, while stressing the need for a free press.

Abhishek Singhvi decodes Arvind Kejriwal's bail conditions: He can sign files...Senior lawyer Abhishek Manu Singhvi cleared up the confusion over Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's ability to sign official files, emphasising that the Supreme Court's recent order has not altered prior conditions.

Air Force Wing Commander accused of rape by woman officer gets pre-arrest bailA 26-year-old woman Flying Officer has alleged that she was subjected to "continuous harassment, sexual assault, and mental torture" by one of her seniors.

This is my happy place: Sunita Williams on extended stay in spaceSunita Williams said that the transition to station life was "not that hard" since both had previous stints there. "This is my happy place. I love being up here in space," she remarked.
Arvind Kejriwal walks out of jail with 'courage, morale increased 100 times'Prison cannot weaken Kejriwal's courage, the Delhi Chief Minister said, hours after he was granted bail.

Port Blair renamed Sri Vijaya Puram 'to free nation from colonial imprints'Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced the renaming of Port Blair, the capital of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, as Sri Vijaya Puram. The renaming was done to "free the nation from colonial imprints" as part of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's vision.

Telangana announces transgender traffic troops under new recruitment programmeTransgender persons will be trained and recruited to assist the Hyderabad traffic police under the new scheme announced by Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy.
Be quiet: Joe Biden rebukes reporter asking about Putin's war threat to USThe incident happened as Joe Biden and UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer held a key meeting at the White House in Washington.

Realised father on hijacked plane, while handling 1984 crisis, says Jaishankar External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar recalled the time when he was handling a hijacking crisis and discovered that his father was on that hijacked flight. Jaishankar opened up about the 1984 Indian Airlines plane hijacking as the Netflix series, IC 814 - The Kandahar Hijack, brought back memories of the 1999 hostage-taking incident.

Singer Justin Timberlake pleads guilty to impaired driving in New YorkThe pop star Justin Timberlake originally pleaded not guilty to a misdemeanour charge of driving while intoxicated and had his driver's license suspended during a hearing last month.

In pics: Rain, blessings, warm hug greet Arvind Kejriwal as he walks out of jailDelhi Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal walked out of Tihar Jail on Friday evening, after the Supreme Court granted him bail in the Delhi excise policy case. The Chief Minister's wife Sunita Kejriwal, senior AAP leader Manish Sisodia, Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann and Delhi Minister Atishi, were among the people who received Kejriwal as he walked out of jail. The AAP chief delivered a speech after coming out of the jail amid heavy rain in the capital region. He also held a roadshow in the Civil Lines area in Delhi, before leaving for his house. He received a warm welcome upon reaching his house as well.

Who's the Blair after whom Port Blair was namedThe Central government on September 13 announced that Port Blair, the capital of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, will now be known as Sri Vijaya Puram. This has been done to remove the colonial imprints of the earlier name. But who was the Blair after whom Port Blair was named?

How 5 terrorists freed for home minister's daughter set a benchmarkRubaiya Sayeed, the daughter of then Union Home Minister Mufti Mohammad Sayeed, was kidnapped by five JKLF terrorists in Srinagar in 1989. She was freed after five days in exchange for five terrorists. That hostage swap set a "benchmark", and emboldened the IC 814 Kandahar hijackers of 1999.
How I was assaulted by Rahul Gandhi's team in Dallas, TexasA nightmare unfolded after I asked Indian Overseas Congress chief Sam Pitroda a question linked to Rahul Gandhi's US visit.

X account hacked: Noida official clarifies 'Pappu' jibe at Rahul Gandhi in postGautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Manish Verma said that his social media account was hacked, leading to derogatory posts targeting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi.

Leopard spotted near Wayanad highway, sparking fear among localsCCTV footage captured a leopard roaming near the Wayanad National Highway at 4 am on Friday in Tamil Nadu's Gudalur village, causing concern among the residents.

Will bail conditions hinder Arvind Kejriwal ahead of crucial Haryana polls?While the bail conditions may present some challenges for Arvind Kejriwal, they are unlikely to significantly hinder his political aspirations.

Avinash Sable finishes 9th, Kenya's Serem beats Olympic champion El BakkaliDiamond League Final 2024: India's national record holder Avinash Sable finished 9th in the 12-man race in Brussels on Friday. 22-year-old Kenyan Amos Serem won the Diamond Trophy, beating Olympic champion Soufiane El Bakkali in a thrilling finish.

ED detains four in Tamil Nadu in Rs 1 crore online transaction probeThe Enforcement Directorate has detained four individuals from Tiruvallur in Tamil Nadu, in connection with an investigation into a Rs 1 crore online transaction, following a raid on their residence.

Caged parrot taunt returns to hauntThe imagery of a caged parrot is centuries old and has to do with Vasco da Gama's travels to India. The "caged parrot" metaphor has been used by the Supreme Court for the CBI not just in the Arvind Kejriwal liquorgate case but earlier in 2013 in the coal scam case, when the Congress was in power.

India successfully conducts first phase field trials of light tank in key stepThe Army announced the successful completion of the first phase of field firing trials for the Indian Light Tank, which will enhance India's combat capability along the borders.

Mumbai woman arrested in Telangana for sending people to Cambodia for cybercrimesA Mumbai woman was arrested for allegedly trafficking job seekers to Cambodia where they were forced into cybercriminal activities under abusive conditions.

Uttar Pradesh man killed in accident while returning home after 9 years in prisonThe man was released from prison on Wednesday and was returning home in an autorickshaw with his wife and daughter, when an SUV hit it from behind. His daughter also died in the incident, while his wife and the rickshaw driver were injured in the incident.

Jaya Bachchan hates it when photographers catch her off-guard, says paparazzoVeteran actor and politician Jaya Bachchan hates it when photographers catch her off-guard, said paparazzo Manav Manglani. He also disclosed additional details about Jaya's reaction to the media.

Raveena Tandon apologises to fans for denying a selfie, shares why she walked awayActor Raveena Tandon recently recalled the time when a group of fans approached her for selfies in London, causing her to panic and walk away. She apologised to them on X and explained the reason for her sudden departure.

Aparshakti Khurana says his bond with Ayushmann is 'old school Ram-Lakshman' kindIn a viral video, Aparshakti Khurana can be seen touching his brother Ayushmann Khurrana's feet at an event. The former reacted to the clip and opened up about his bond with his brother.

Watch: First song from Bohurupi, Shimul Polash outThe first song from the upcoming Pujo release, Bohurupi, titled Shimul Polash, beautifully captures the journey of Bikram and Jhimli's married life. The song features Shiboprosad Mukherjee, who dances for the first time, and Koushani Mukherjee, showcasing a lively wedding and their family-building journey.

Mitchell Marsh ruled out of 2nd T20I, Travis Head to lead AustraliaENG vs AUS: Travis Head has been named as the captain for the second T20I in place of Mitchell Marsh, who is unwell. Australia are leading the 3-match T20I series.

Sarfaraz likened Rohit to Aamir Khan's character from the Bollywood film Lagaan.

Unjust removing Shaheen Shah Afridi as T20I captain: Moin Khan Moin Khan said that Pakistan should have persisted with Shaheen Shah Afridi as the skipper of the Pakistan T20I team. Earlier this year, Babar Azam replaced Shaheen as the captain in the shorter format.

The Indian football team has recently lost the Intercontinental Cup to Syria and Bhutia feels it is high time AIFF starts focusing on taking the game forward.

On topsy-turvy day for Shreyas Iyer, India A extend lead beyond 200Duleep Trophy 2024: Shreyas Iyer fell for naught, but he picked up a crucial wicket in the final over of the day's play. However, India A, led by Mayank Agarwal, dominated with both bat and ball, taking a 222-run lead at Stumps on Day 2 in Anantapur.

Indian football is going down, time to overhaul federation: Bhaichung BhutiaIndian legend and former captain Bhaichung Bhutia has called for the All India Football Federation to be completely overhauled after a string of poor results by the national team in recent times.

Bangladesh to take a call on Hathurusinghe's tenure before home seasonBCB chief Faruque Ahmed said that instead of taking a rash decision, Bangladesh would review Chandika Hathurusinghe's performance as head coach before taking a call on his tenure.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
